page.title: 10 FARMING - HEAP FOLD FARM
page.content:
{Heap Fold Farm}is 300 years old. The farmer gets up at{5.30am.}There are three kinds of animals,{geese, cows and{hens.}Angela gets up and collects the{eggs.}She takes the{eggs}into a room. There is a big machine in the room. She sorts all the{eggs}into rows. Ther are some for small{eggs, medium{eggs}and some for big{eggs. When the{eggs}are all sorted out, Angela puts them into boxes and sells them. Each{cow}gives 32 pints of{milk}a day. David feeds the cows on{dairy nuts. The{cows}and the{hens}are not allowed outside. They have got to stay in little huts. There are three{hens}in a cage. The{cows}have to stay in a stable with some straw.
{Rebecca Pearson - Heap Bridge C.P.
